content.question: Which of the following correctly indicates the direction of the induced current in the loop (as viewed from the bar magnet) and provides a valid justification?

choices.label: Counterclockwise, because the magnetic flux through the loop is increasing and the induced current will oppose the change in flux.
Counterclockwise, because the magnetic flux through the loop is decreasing and the induced current will oppose the change in flux.
Clockwise, because the magnetic flux through the loop is increasing and the induced current will oppose the change in flux.
Clockwise, because the magnetic flux through the loop is decreasing and the induced current will oppose the change in flux.

content.answer: Counterclockwise, because the magnetic flux through the loop is increasing and the induced current will oppose the change in flux.

skill.text: 3.C: Justify or support a claim using evidence from experimental data, physical representations, or physical principles or laws.
